definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: Netbooks are a hot-selling consumer product.

sentences.english: The popular Toyota Prius, for example, is not yet manufactured in the United States.

sentences.english: Now mostly sheep blankets comparison of sell like hot cakes.

sentences.english: “Forever” multiple speed racing bicycles are sure to be sellable in your market.

sentences.english: This mattress sells pretty well and this promotion ends tomorrow.

sentences.english: Maintaining the Cruze's sales momentum won't be easy, though.
sentences.chinese: 不過，要保持克魯茲的熱銷勢頭並非易事。

sentences.english: The product suddenly took off in September.

sentences.english: Our products are exported to Europe, America, Middle-east and Asian countries widely.
sentences.chinese: 凱高產品廣泛地熱銷到歐洲，美洲，中東及亞洲各國。

sentences.english: "HONO" is one of the hot brands of Badi products which has been authorized the international registered trade mark.

definition: to sell strongly/to be in great demand

to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
